result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:01 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Tim Hogan.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hogan has received a copy of the presentence investigation with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation with no corrections, additions or deletions.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing argument by Atty Vanden Branden.  Sentencing argument by Atty Hogan.  Statenment by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

4 years of Initial Confinement and 6 years of Extended Supervision

CONDITIONS:

court costs
Register as sex offender
AODA and any follow-up
No contact with any minors without permission from agent
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent
Sexual offender treatment
No Contact with the victim or the victim;'s family.
Sentence is to commence immediately.

Court finds the defendant not eligible for the CIP & SAP.

Court grants the defendant sentence credit from March 13, 2014 to present.

Court adjourned at 2:15 p.m.
to counsel with copy of the Pre Sentence Investigation Report
Sentencing hearing on January 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

3:02 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Timothy Hogan.

ADA recites agreement - defendant plea to count 2 - DRI count 1.  Counsel is requesting a Presentence Investigation Report.  Attorney Hogan concurs.  Defendant concurs.  ADA confirms compliance with any victim/witness rights.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.  Court goes over the elements of the offense.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court instructs regarding deportation.  Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to count 2.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 and orders a judgment of conviction be entered today.  Court DRI count 1.   Court orders a Presentence Investigation Report be completed within 60 days - sentencing to be held thereafter.

Court adjourned at 3:09 p.m.

2:11 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Timothy Hogan present on behalf of the defendant.

Statement by Attorney Hogan - requests matter be set for Plea Hearing.  Has been set for October 28, 2014 at 3:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:12p.m.
Plea hearing on October 28, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

for Pretrial Orders (Defendant's)

Motion to Modify Bond

Statement by Attorney Hogan - defendant will be waiving his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing - waived by the defendant - court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

ADA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Hogan.  Attorney Hogan confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading  - enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.

Court directs status hearing to be held in approximately sixty days.

Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $10,000.00 cash bond and conditions of:  No Contact with ES and No Contact with anyone named in the criminal complaint.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
